text: The Hosteria La Selva tree frog or ranita arb√≥rea de Miyata (Dendropsophus miyatai) is a frog that lives in Ecuador, Peru and Colombia. Scientists have seen it as high as 300 meters above sea level. The adult male frog is 16.3 to 18.1 mm long from nose to rear end and the adult female frog is 20 to 21 mm long. This frog is bright red in color with some yellow, orange and red spots. ==References== Category:Frogs of South America
title: Hosteria La Selva tree frog
